etymology.description: 电(電) (diàn, "electric") + 话(話) (huà, "speech; talk") = means of electric speech -> telephone
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 电(電) (diàn, "electric") and 话(話) (huà, "speech; talk") reflects the concept of using electricity to transmit speech over distances, which is the fundamental principle of a telephone. The term accurately captures the invention's purpose, aligning with technological advancements in communication.

examples.chinese: 我正在打电话(我正在打電話)。
examples.english: I am making a phone call.

examples.chinese: 他昨天接到了一个紧急的电话(他昨天接到了一個緊急的電話)，匆忙出门(匆忙出門)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuótiān jiē dào le yīgè jǐnjí de diànhuà, cōngmáng chūmén.
examples.english: He received an urgent phone call yesterday and hurried out.
